entries.content: "I don't have time" is often just a reflex on how to get rid of a sales call.
entries.notes: Understanding the nature of this initial barrier is key before applying frameworks like Clarify-Isolate-Overcome or LAARC.

entries.content: After a prospect says "I don't have time", ask "When is a good time to call you back?".
entries.notes: A method to navigate past the initial barrier, prompting the prospect to potentially ask 'What's it about?', aligning with the 'Assess'/'Respond' steps in LAARC.

entries.content: Asking "When can I call you back?" can shift the prospect's frame of mind from resistance to asking "What's it about?".
entries.notes: Highlights the impact of a question in moving past the initial 'I don't have time' barrier, relevant to the assessment phase in LAARC.

entries.content: When the prospect asks "What's it about?", be very directed in what you say.
entries.notes: Relates to the 'Respond' phase in LAARC.

entries.content: Use a question designed to see the prospect's reaction regarding the call's purpose.
entries.notes: Example: 'If I told you it was about sales training would a little piece of you die?'. A specific tactic within the 'Respond'/'Assess' phases of LAARC.
